messages.subject: Add gitre v0.1.0 CLI for AI-powered commit message reconstruction
messages.body:
Implement Typer CLI with `analyze` and `commit` commands. The `analyze`
command walks repository history, extracts diffs, and generates meaningful
commit messages and changelog entries via Claude (claude-agent-sdk). The
`commit` command applies cached proposals to rewrite history using
git-filter-repo.

Includes Keep a Changelog formatting, batch analysis, selective commit
filtering with --only/--skip, cache validation with HEAD staleness
detection, automatic backup branch creation, large diff truncation,
multi-strategy JSON extraction, Pydantic v2 models, and a comprehensive
test suite with autouse Claude SDK mocking.
messages.changelog_entry: Initial release of gitre, an AI-powered CLI tool that reconstructs meaningful git commit messages and changelogs by analyzing diffs with Claude, featuring a two-step analyze-then-commit workflow, Keep a Changelog formatting, batch analysis, selective commit filtering, and git history rewriting via git-filter-repo.

messages.subject: Add comprehensive README with usage guide and SDK details
messages.body:
Replace placeholder description with full documentation covering
prerequisites, Claude Code / Agent SDK integration, command reference
with option tables, usage examples, safety notes, and project structure.
Update CHANGELOG.md with corresponding entry.
messages.changelog_entry: README with prerequisites, Claude Code / Agent SDK integration details, full command reference, and usage examples.

messages.subject: Add workflow reminders and SDK notes to CLAUDE.md
messages.body:
Add changelog discipline reminder and Claude Agent SDK configuration
details (bypassPermissions, output_format schemas, max_turns, multi-strategy
JSON extraction) to project instructions. Update CHANGELOG.md accordingly.
messages.changelog_entry: CLAUDE.md project instructions with workflow reminders and Claude Agent SDK configuration notes.

messages.subject: Add COMMANDS.md with full CLI reference and workflow examples
messages.body:
Document the analyze and commit subcommands with their arguments,
options, and usage examples. Include typical workflow patterns for
one-shot, two-step, and selective rewrite scenarios.
messages.changelog_entry: COMMANDS.md with full CLI reference covering all subcommands, options, and typical workflow examples.

messages.subject: Show progress output by default instead of only with --verbose
messages.body:
Display spinners and status messages (fetching, enriching, generating,
saving) on every run. The --verbose flag now adds per-commit hash detail
for debugging rather than being required for any user feedback at all.

Also add progress spinners to batch generation path that previously had
no progress indication even with --verbose.
messages.changelog_entry: Progress output (spinners, status messages) is now always shown during analysis, not only with `--verbose`. The `--verbose` flag now adds per-commit hash detail for debugging instead of being required for any feedback.

messages.subject: Make git-filter-repo a required dependency
messages.body:
Move git-filter-repo from optional [rewrite] extra into main
dependencies. Remove stale tree-sitter entries that were incorrectly
listed under [rewrite].
messages.changelog_entry: git-filter-repo moved from optional to required dependency — it is now installed automatically with gitre. Removed the unused [rewrite] optional extra along with stale tree-sitter entries.

messages.subject: Fix Windows command-line length limit in filter-repo callback
messages.body:
Write the message-callback script to a temporary file instead of passing
it inline via the command line. With many commits the callback easily
exceeds Windows' 8,191-char cmd.exe limit, causing WinError 206.

The temp file is cleaned up in a finally block to ensure removal even
when filter-repo fails.
messages.changelog_entry: Write filter-repo callback to a temp file instead of passing inline — fixes Windows command-line length limit (WinError 206) on repos with many commits.

messages.subject: Fix history rewrite to use commit-callback with hash matching
messages.body:
Switch from --message-callback (content matching) to --commit-callback
(hash matching via commit.original_id). When many commits share the
same original message like "etc", the content-based dict collapses
duplicate keys and the last mapping wins — giving every commit the
same rewritten message. Hash-based matching is unique per commit.
messages.changelog_entry: Switch from `--message-callback` to `--commit-callback` with hash-based matching — fixes all commits getting the same message when many share identical original messages (e.g. "etc").

messages.subject: Stop auto-gitignoring .gitre/ cache directory
messages.body:
Remove automatic .gitignore management (both inner .gitre/.gitignore
creation and root .gitignore injection) so that the analysis cache is
tracked by git and survives history rewrites and repo restores.

Delete _add_to_root_gitignore helper and related tests, simplify
remaining test suite numbering.
messages.changelog_entry: Stop auto-gitignoring the `.gitre/` directory — the analysis cache is now tracked by git so it survives history rewrites and repo restores.

messages.subject: Change default model from sonnet to opus
messages.body:
Switch the default --model option in the CLI from sonnet to opus
to provide higher quality analysis out of the box.
messages.changelog_entry: Default `--model` changed from `sonnet` to `opus` for higher quality analysis.

messages.subject: Fix Windows Unicode crash and preserve analysis cache
messages.body:
Force UTF-8 encoding on Rich console output to avoid cp1252
UnicodeEncodeError when commit messages contain non-ASCII characters.

Stop deleting analysis.json after history rewrite so the cache is
preserved for safety and re-runs.
messages.changelog_entry: Fix UnicodeEncodeError crash on Windows (cp1252) by forcing UTF-8 on Rich console output, and stop deleting analysis.json after rewrite so the cache is preserved for safety.

messages.subject: Automate post-rewrite workflow with remote save/restore and --push flag
messages.body:
Wrap git-filter-repo calls with save_remotes()/restore_remotes() so remotes
survive history rewrites automatically. Add commit_artifacts() to stage and
commit .gitre/ cache and changelog after rewriting. Introduce --push flag on
both `analyze --live` and `commit` to force-push the rewritten branch to the
first configured remote.

Replace cache.clear_cache with rewriter.commit_artifacts in the commit flow
and update all related tests to cover the new behavior.
messages.changelog_entry: Automate the post-rewrite workflow: remotes are now saved and restored around git-filter-repo, artifacts are committed automatically, and a new `--push` flag force-pushes the rewritten branch to the remote.

messages.subject: Validate that --push requires --live on analyze command
messages.body:
Add an early flag-combination check in the analyze command that exits
with a clear error when --push is used without --live. Include a
corresponding CLI test to verify the behaviour.
messages.changelog_entry: The `analyze` command now exits with a clear error when `--push` is passed without `--live`, preventing silent misuse of incompatible flags.

messages.subject: Fix documentation drift: sync docs and docstrings with codebase
messages.body:
Correct Python version requirement (3.11+), default model (opus),
git-filter-repo dependency status (required), and --verbose flag
description in CLAUDE.md and COMMANDS.md. Document the --push flag
for both analyse and commit commands. Update module docstrings in
rewriter.py and cache.py to reflect current implementation details.
messages.changelog_entry: Fix documentation drift by syncing CLAUDE.md, COMMANDS.md, and module docstrings with the actual codebase, correcting the Python version, default model, dependency status, flag descriptions, and adding the missing --push flag documentation.

messages.subject: Expand README with full rewrite pipeline and compatibility info
messages.body:
Rewrite How It Works section with two-phase pipeline details covering
backup, remote save/restore, hash-based rewrite, artifact commit, and
force-push. Add Compatibility section documenting support for GitHub,
GitLab, Azure DevOps, Bitbucket, and standard Git remotes. Expand Safety
section with remote restore and explicit push-only behaviour.

Fix Python version requirement from 3.10+ to 3.11+ to match pyproject.toml.
Correct default --model from sonnet to opus and document missing --push flag.
Update --verbose description and fix module docstrings in rewriter.py and
cache.py.
messages.changelog_entry: Rewrite README documentation with detailed two-phase pipeline explanation, add Compatibility section for supported Git remotes, and fix several inaccuracies including Python version requirement, default model, and missing --push flag.
